sentences.en: Anne had to be aroused from a deep sleep.
sentences.cn: 不得不把安妮从沉睡中唤醒。

sentences.en: At dawn the farmers began to arouse.
sentences.cn: 黎明时农民们开始醒来。

sentences.en: Beggars almost sell themselves as human being to arouse the pity of passers - by .
sentences.cn: 乞丐出售的几乎是他本人,以引起 过路人 的怜悯.

sentences.en: Elections to positions in student organizations arouse much enthusiasm.
sentences.cn: 他们对于在学生组织中任职选举热情很高.

sentences.en: He fell into a sound sleep, don't arouse him.
sentences.cn: 他睡熟了, 别唤醒他.

sentences.en: He was trying to plant the seed of revolt, arouse that placid peasant docility.
sentences.cn: 他想撒下反叛的种子, 唤醒这个安分驯良的农民的觉悟.

sentences.en: Hillsden scrupulously avoided any topic likely to arouse suspicion as to his motives.
sentences.cn: 希尔斯登缄口不提任何可能使人们对他的动机产生怀疑的话题。

sentences.en: His revolutionary work in linguistics has aroused intense scholarly interest.
sentences.cn: 他在语言学方面的革命性著作引起了强烈的学术兴趣。

sentences.en: In some way he depended upon the excitement he could arouse in her hysterical nature.
sentences.cn: 从某一方面来说,他需要从她歇斯底里的本性中得到刺激.

sentences.en: It was some trouble to arouse the little sleeper.
sentences.cn: 要唤醒那酣睡中的孩子实在有点费劲.

sentences.en: Matt’s behavior was arousing the interest of the neighbors.
sentences.cn: 马特的行为渐渐引起了邻居的兴趣。

sentences.en: Silly mistakes and queer clothes often arouse ridicule.
sentences.cn: 荒谬的错误和古怪的服装常会引起人们的讪笑.

sentences.en: The appearance of the opening duck seemed first to arouse the Hurons from their apathy.
sentences.cn: 张开的船帆的出现立即引起了休仑人的警觉.

sentences.en: The battle roared; a sound calculated to arouse the sublimest emotions in the breast of the soldier.
sentences.cn: 战场上吼声震天，意在唤起士兵们最昂扬的斗志。

sentences.en: The smell of frying bacon aroused his hunger.
sentences.cn: 煎咸肉的味道激起了他的饥饿感。

sentences.en: The Treaty has failed to arouse genuine public outrage.
sentences.cn: 该协定并未真正激起公愤。

sentences.en: This sort of " discovery " is unlikely to arouse appreciation!
sentences.cn: 这种 “ 发现 ” 无疑不会得到赞赏!

sentences.en: We left in the daytime so as not to arouse suspicion.
sentences.cn: 我们在白天离开以避免引起怀疑。

sentences.en: We must arouse them to fight for their own emancipation.
sentences.cn: 我们必须唤起他们为其自身的解放而斗争.

sentences.en: We must arouse them to fight with enemies.
sentences.cn: 我们必须唤起他们同敌人斗争.

trans.tran_en: to make you become interested, expect something etc

trans.tran_cn: 引起； 唤起， 唤醒
